item.title: Some Commands to Interact with a GNU/Linux Server
item.description: Connecting to the server To connect to the server: ssh my_user@my_server If you have a desktop environment installed on your server, you can use -X flag. This enables launching GUI apps from the server on your local PC. Here is an example: ssh -X my_user@my_server # ...auth... nautilus Finding your way in terminal pwd command shows where you are. pwd # /home/my_user/my_awesome_dir To change directory use cd: cd path-to-go To list contents of a directiory:
